metadata.name: Persistence Via Cron Files
metadata.comment: Detects creation of cron file or files in Cron directories which could indicates potential persistence.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (startswith(lower(file.path), lower('/etc/cron.d/')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('/etc/cron.daily/')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('/etc/cron.hourly/')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('/etc/cron.monthly/')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('/etc/cron.weekly/')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('/var/spool/cron/crontabs/')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('/etc/cron.allow')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('/etc/cron.deny')) OR contains(lower(file.path), lower('/etc/crontab'))))

output.summary: Detects creation of cron file or files in Cron directories which could indicates potential persistence.

metadata.objective: False positive: Any legitimate cron file. Reference: https://github.com/microsoft/MSTIC-Sysmon/blob/f1477c0512b0747c1455283069c21faec758e29d/linux/configs/attack-based/persistence/T1053.003_Cron_Activity.xml
